thread.title: Kim Dotcom#039;s Crazy Plan to Save the Music Business Shut Down
thread.title_full: Kim Dotcom#039;s Crazy Plan to Save the Music Business Shut Down

title: Kim Dotcom#039;s Crazy Plan to Save the Music Business Shut Down
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
8 Sep 2015 06:11 AM EST 
Kim Dotcom is known to be more than a little eccentric. The former CEO of the now defunct file sharing site Megaupload laid out in detail in a call with Universal Music Group executives how Megaupload was working on its own music service dubbed Megabox. Megabox is integrated with a technology dubbed Megakey that would have prompted users to install a small program on their computers. The software would then monitor the computer’s entire network traffic, intercept advertising from third-party websites and swap out ten percent of all ads for advertising from Dotcom’s own ad network.
